none: Appr. to A&M College, circa April 1871-1885
Appr. to A&M College, circa April 1871-1885
Box 4 Louis L. McInnis Papers/Box 4 Folder 12 Louis L. McInnis Papers

en: Financial record documenting appropriations made to an Agricultural and Mechanical College between April 1871 and 1885, totaling $485,787.44 from both state general revenue and university funds. The document lists specific allocations for buildings, library apparatus, agricultural implements, debt reduction, repairs, and maintenance, along with a statement explaining revenue sources (students, officers, professors, farm produce) and expenditure categories (student maintenance, staff salaries, operational expenses). This ledger reflects the institutional development and financial management of a land-grant college during the post-Reconstruction era.

The word "Add" looks a little messy, but it's clearly an addition, so that's how I'll transcribe it. The letters "Viz" looks like "Viz-". "incidental to the operation & mainten" is cut off at the edge. The word appears to be "maintenance" but the last few letters are missing. However, the next line has "of the College" and completes the sentence. The "State Approp. of 19th Legis." are both abbreviated. And "11" represents ditto marks.

The numbers are all formatted the same.
